Description: surrogate key
The type of reference value (eg, RefEmailAddressType, RefStaffSectionRole, etc)
The namespace for the refdefitions, to ensure uniqueness.
The code identifier for the reference value.
A specified sort order for use when displaying the list of ref values.
A description of the ref value.
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.
surrogate key
The name of the extension attribute.
The translation to be used if a more clear naming is needed for display.
The type of data to be recorded for this extension attribute (possible values are: DATETIME, STRING, INT, BOOL, FLAG, or REF).
If DataType is REF, the RefType is required and specifies the enumeration to be used (eg, RefPublicSchoolResidenceStatus)
surrogate key
Name of the system.
The name of the vendor/company of the system (maps to OneRoster's userProfiles.vendorId and resources.vendorId)
Description of the system.
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.
surrogate key
Foreign key to the calendar to which the session belongs.
The name/title of the course.

The official reference number portion of a course identifier.  
This number normally designates the level of the course as well as the level of the individual expected to enroll in the course.
The primary key as assigned by the external system of record.
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.

Foreign key

A unique code assigned to a room by a school, school system, state, or other agency or entity.
The type of section (maps to OneRoster's classes.classType)
The primary key as assigned by the external system of record.
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.

surrogate key
The full legal first name given to a person at birth, baptism, or through legal change.
A full legal middle name given to a person at birth, baptism, or through legal change.
The full legal last name borne in common by members of a family.
An appendage, if any, used to denote a person's generation in his family (e.g., Jr., Sr., III).
An appellation, if any, used to denote rank, placement, or status (e.g., Mr., Ms., Reverend, Sister, Dr., Colonel).
Denotes whether the person is considered an enabled user or whether their access (usernames, identifiers, system access) is disabled. Defaults to true.
Foreign key to SourceSystem table, for the system from which this record of info came.
The primary key as assigned by the external system of record.
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.
surrogate key
Foreign key to person.
The identifier given to the org by the third party system.

The type of identifier, eg: LDAP, Fed, StateId. Note that this value is not necessarily the same as SourceSystem.Name (accessed through the SourceSystemId foreign key). The system name is specifically about the system itself, while the PersonIdentifier.Type is a categorization of the identifier itself.
Foreign key to the system which is the source of the identifier.
The primary key as assigned by the external system of record.
The description for the identifier (eg, User Login, student number).
Used by db for tracking soft-delete. If IsActive is false, the record is understood to have been "soft-deleted" and should be ignored.
Indicates the person has a student role. This allows for more explicit associations in the schema with the student table.
Indicates the person has a staff role. This allows for more explicit associations in the schema with the staff table.
The date and time of the activity, for a given hour (activity sum is calculated per hour)
The UPN (User Principal Name from Active Directory) identifying the user who has performed the activity
The object id that uniquely identifies the user (some events utilize UserId, while others utilize UPN)
The application the activity was recorded from (one of: Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, PDF viewers, Image apps, Media apps, Other apps)
Summation of the number of signals recorded during the hour for the given activity
Info on the client used to access the application (eg, Mozilla/5.0 WIndows, Mozilla/5.0 Macintosh)
The number of minutes of the recorded activity, occuring during the specified date and hour of day.
Category of the activity (one of: Assignments, Communications, Files, Meetings)
